meanings.sent1: He received a claut on his head during the fight.
meanings.sent2: The boxer delivered a powerful claut to his opponent's jaw.
meanings.sent3: The claut from the falling branch knocked some sense into him.
meanings.sent4: The news of her betrayal felt like a claut to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The thunderous claut of the hammer echoed through the workshop.

meanings.sent1: She clauted the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would claut the red-hot iron to shape it.
meanings.sent3: He clauted the ball so hard it flew over the fence.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to claut the earth with rain.
meanings.sent5: The giant's footsteps clauted heavily on the forest floor.

meanings.definition: To mend or patch up hastily and clumsily.
meanings.sent1: She tried to claut the tear in her dress with safety pins.
meanings.sent2: He had to claut the broken vase back together before his mom found out.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to claut the burnt dish with extra seasoning.
meanings.sent4: The magician tried to claut the torn paper with tape during his act.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to claut the engine to get the car running again.
